website_summaries.verdict: If your bird already has plenty of destructible toys, this sturdy spoon, ring, and chain piece is all set to fill a more permanent position.
pros: Stainless steel spoons offer both visual and audio stimulation
Colorful rings help spice things up and provide beaks with something to chew on or toy with
Rowdy birds are rewarded by satisfying clanging during playtime
Can be hung horizontally or vertically, depending on your bird's preference or cage size
Doubles as a swing or perch in a horizontal position
cons: Shy, smaller birds might find the size and noise intimidating
Playtime is bound to be noisy

customer_reviews.title: Not Stainless, Not Bird-Safe (Zinc Plated)
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing to find that the spoon toy delivered used zinc-plated hardware and was not stainless, as advertised. Additionally, the links and the rings are not welded, with small gaps that potentially catch a talon. No doubt a lot of fun, but not worth the risks for us. Definitely raises questions about Booda Bird toys, especially when reading of foam parts in their chewable toys in reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kletsky

customer_reviews.title: Better to take it apart
customer_reviews.text: We have a conure and an African Grey. This toy is very heavy and neither bird had an interest in it until we tore it apart. Now, the African Grey loves to play with the spoons and plastic pieces on the table. He beats the spoons on the table, making an awful racket, and throws the plastics over the side for us to fetch. He has a ball with them daily? We keep them just for table playtime. He didn't like them when hanging. Our conure still has no interest in them. Note - the chain is cheap metal and begin to rust. I wish they would make this in just the pieces. We threw away the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My bird LOVES this!!!! I have a Cockatoo, and she loves to play. Sometimes looking at herself, sometimes making a racket with them. Mine was different in picture, It only had one quick link, not 2, so it hands vertically, not horizontally as shown in photo. I just added another one I had, but just wanted to let everyone know that. I think its a must have toy for your feathered friends!
customer_reviews.author: Solstice

customer_reviews.title: Great bird toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a few of these because we have several large birds and so far, I am very happy with the product. Each bird has taken a different level of fondness to it, but what's great, is so far, they've been able to knock it down and still play with it. I like that if they are ever able to disassemble it, we could remake something with it because the parts are durable. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: A good toy for a little bird
customer_reviews.text: A cute little toy for my green cheek conure. He wasn't instantly attracted to it but he started seeing his reflection in the spoons and seems to play with it more now. It's not very noisy even when the metal spoons jingle, which I appreciate. A good toy for a little bird.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy. It’s not Bird Safe. It Quickly Rusts.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOT STAINLESS STEEL! I bought in May but didn’t get my bird until the end of July. I soaked it in dish-soapy water for 10 mins and later on towel to dry overnight. Woke up this morning to RUST. Put a magnet near the spoons and the entire toy jumped up to attach to the magnet. Stainless Steel is not magnetic, nor does it rust. I doubt this crap is even plated. I though Bonka Bird was going to be a quality bird toy brand. Not.
customer_reviews.author: bridgetgidget

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Parrots Love
customer_reviews.text: Three of the plastic rings were broken in the package when I received this today. I’m not sending back. My birds love it anyway. Just want to say that maybe better packaging needs to be conducted on further customer orders.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Von Seggern

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my girls playtime attention
customer_reviews.text: my doorbell rang, of course, my gey is announcing Doorbell neighbors come visit my cag I found a package and I pick it up, my girl starts grabbing the package was having a fit until I got her toy out and hung, she l loves her shiny spoons, 24 hrs later still has her attention funny because she is no longer arguing with my husky when the husky comes in the room recomeed it highly
customer_reviews.author: Keith clark

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TOY, SIMPLY AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey LOVES, LOVES, LOVES this toy. Her eyes sparkle. I was having a hard time trying to figure out how I was going to hang it in her cage. I hung it from the top of her cage where it hangs down and she can grab it when she is on her perch. She CONSTANTLY chews on it. It makes her so happy. I didn't think she would like it - BOY WAS I MISTAKEN.
customer_reviews.author: Feather Baby Mom

customer_reviews.title: My African grey loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey’s all time favorite toy. He loves his spoons so much I later bought the measuring cup toy to go with it. 😂 He’s been so so happy with it. Just keep in mind it is a very jingly, noisy toy!
customer_reviews.author: Db

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The spoons and toy are of high quality. Our Amazon parrot checks it out and tries to pull it apart, but cannot. Our birdie loves bells, so if bells were added she’d probably love it even more. I added another connector so it hangs horizontally, and she likes to stand or hang on it. The chain is of a good thickness that it doesn’t worry me that she’ll get a claw caught. I may add bells to spice it up.
customer_reviews.author: SDGranola

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous toy
customer_reviews.text: My CAG got her beak caught in the chain. It was very traumatic for her. We had to towel her and pry the link apart. We were very lucky that there was minimal damage to her beat and tounge,and no soft tissue damage. I buy alot of Bonka toys and was surprised that the links were not bonded properly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking Good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Kumquat, a black capped caique, hasn't been able to destroy any part of it, but he does love looking into the shiny spoons to see his reflection. Thankfully, he isn't obsessed with the view because it's not a hundred percent clear. Perfect toy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Lily S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Attractive bird toy
customer_reviews.text: It was received on time and intact. We like the look and construction of this bird toy. However, we have not yet given it to our Gray. So, it is not yet been bird tested. Though he is slow to accept new items put in his cage, we expect he will like it.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My African Gray has played with this toy every day since we gave it to him for Christmas. For some reason, he loves to fiddle with the spoons more than I have ever seen him play with any other toy component.
customer_reviews.author: BoS

customer_reviews.title: Good quality toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these at a discount through Amazon Warehouse. The toy appears to be safe. I did not see any safety concerns. The spoons and rings are very durable. I have a Sun Conure. As soon as I hung it in his cage, he went right over and started playing with the spoons. Definitely worth the money. Recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Katharine L.

customer_reviews.title: My Macaw LOVES this toy
customer_reviews.text: my B&G Macaw LOVES this toy he usually destroys his toys in a day or 2 but this one has lasted for over a month and he is slowly destroying it but for the price it was well worth it I will be buying another once he has gone through this it is his fav toy that I have bought him so far. He know how to unscrew the hooks so I do have to reattach a few times a day for him but that is fine it is what Parrots love to do take stuff apart if he is happy I am happy
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty satisfied
customer_reviews.text: If you have a bird that likes clinging things and making loud sounds this Toy might suit them, it's also one of those toys where it technically never will be destroyed but I do take it out every once in awhile to clean it and so it won't get boring. my African Grey goes nuts and just aggressively swings it around everywhere against the bars and makes loud metal clanking sounds which he loves.
customer_reviews.author: Connerj

customer_reviews.title: Provides much enjoyment for my bird
customer_reviews.text: I think my bird enjoys the noise of playing with this toy - metal against metal keeps it from being boring but he has not yet totally taken the toy apart! In this case 'thickness' is not an aspect of the toy
customer_reviews.author: Sue Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Our TAG loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived literally 10 minutes ago and our TAG is already going bonkers over it. I can hear the spoons rattling from the kitchen. He's *very* rowdy with his toys and when I saw that this one was holding up well for other parrot owners I figured I'd get a couple. I'll update if there are any issues, but as of right now this is definitely on the list of the most durable parrot toys ever.
customer_reviews.author: I V Parsley

customer_reviews.title: Reflects light and captures their attention
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy for the top of the cage when my African Grey is at liberty. She loves the reflections that the spoons capture and will talk to it and play with it. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MSShopper3330

customer_reviews.title: Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy for my Senegal and he loves it! I also got the one with the measuring cups for my Timneh. Both are a hit and a little less noisy than toys with a lot of bells.
customer_reviews.author: L. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for sugar gliders
customer_reviews.text: Some of these spoons are bigger than the gliders. :) I can take it apart and use pieces so not a complete bust. I made the mistake of rinsing them off and not drying it immediately. Don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: kay3k

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but maybe not for Cockatoos
customer_reviews.text: We received this toy a couple hours ago and our GSC Cockatoo loves it so much he already broke off three of the acrylic pacifiers! We’re waiting to see how long it takes him to destroy the spoons! 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Leevje

customer_reviews.title: yes
customer_reviews.text: wow i got this for my Lovebird. . . This is definitely a toy for much larger birds. But she loves it anyway. Very sturdy I dont think even amd African grey could destroy this!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fun noise maker
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey likes to bang things around for attention when he wants to get out of his cage. I hung these straight down near his door and he loves to rattle them around when he wants to come out. They are not too noisy to be annoying though, so they are a perfect noise making toy for his cage!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality
customer_reviews.text: My bird destroyed this toy that I had bought from a bird store so I found it on amazon and I feel like this one is much better quality. My conure can’t take apart and destroy this one like it did the other I had. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Myshell

customer_reviews.title: MUST GET !!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is .... must have. You have a Parrot ... get this, get this, get this. He wakes up and goes to sleep working on this. Make it interesting by changing the location inside your cage every month. About to order a 2nd, since he is learning to come in and out of his cage. This will keep him busy in one spot out of the cage. AWESOME !!! ... if the keys would be separated a little more ..... this would be the item for Parrots.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto

customer_reviews.title: Generally he likes things he can destroy - like shred toys and anything made from wood as he ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I should have waited to provide this review as we've only had it 'in play' for 1 day. As would be expected, my Amazon is wary of anything it hasn't seen before so he shied away from it yesterday. Today he's played a little bit with the spoons so I guess his wariness is over and now it can be recognized as a toy. Generally he likes things he can destroy - like shred toys and anything made from wood as he likes to make toothpicks of everything. Whether the spoon toy will be to his liking remains to be seen but I'm optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Colorful Durable Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice! Wish I could get my birds interested in it! At any rate, looks really nice and colorful in the cage and on the play station!
customer_reviews.author: NaturalHarmony

customer_reviews.title: My Macaw, Abby, loves this toy.  Loves taking it apart which takes time,thank goodness.
customer_reviews.text: My Macaw loves this toy. She is taking it apart spoon by spoon. We are saving all the pieces and when she is done we are going to put it all back together again for her to beat the heck out of it. Great toy to keep this gal busy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good toy.
customer_reviews.text: My bird love’s this toy. He likes spoons and keys and I thought he’d love this toy when I saw it. I placed it in his cage and he was no time playing with it. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: My Bird Loves These
customer_reviews.text: My green cheeked conure loves these! He's had them for over a year and while he's destroyed several of his other toys he hasn't been able to destroy these.
customer_reviews.author: NHTFR

customer_reviews.title: Fun, safe toy for curious birds
customer_reviews.text: I have a very busy caique thar gets bored easily. This makes the noise he enjoys while keeping him out of trouble. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Germaine Lytle

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy for parrot
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, very pretty and shiny, metal spoons are great.... my bird was able to snap the metal chain it came on in half on the first day. Dangerous chain.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining toy!
customer_reviews.text: My eclectus loves this toy. She bangs it against the cage bars and shakes it with her beak. Great toy! Durable too. While my bird is a wild child when at play, sometimes she just looks at her reflection in the spoons. It's so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Tena

customer_reviews.title: Jingle...Jingle...Jingle
customer_reviews.text: The moment I put these in my Bare-Eyed's cage, his eyes got SO wide. He jumped on these suckers and started shaking them around, yelling at them and swinging on them! It's all I hear, 8am to 8pm, "jingle jingle." Lol!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Well built parrot toy that unfortunately my cockatoo has no interest in. He seems to only like toys he can destroy if any at all. I have spent more money on trying to find toys he likes, but in the end, he prefers hanging out with his people over toys. I'm sure different parrot species would love this toy, unfortunately not mine.
customer_reviews.author: kyranew

customer_reviews.title: Not just for any bird
customer_reviews.text: Two days into it's new life in the birds house and he already managed to disassemble it. But I fixed it, tag your it!
customer_reviews.author: Mygo

customer_reviews.title: He can't rip it to shreds like all his paper and wooden ones but he loves ...
customer_reviews.text: Our new as in, we've had him for just over a week Cockatoo really really enjoys this toy. He can't rip it to shreds like all his paper and wooden ones but he loves making music with it - a few rattles, a nice scream, a "what a pretty boy" - repeat a few times - you get my drift :)
customer_reviews.author: Miechelle H

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad toy for large Parrots
customer_reviews.text: This toy kept our parrot busy she loved making noise and throwing it around. One thing she was about to get it apart, but we gathered the stuff up and put it back together not as perfect but she is still playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Morris

customer_reviews.title: This was well worth the price - my macaw loves this unique toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a high-quality build. My macaw hadn't seen anything quite like it, so he was very excited to explore and chew on the various goodies. The metal spoons are brilliant - safe and fun to play with. This seems like a durable toy that will last a long time. I can see it'll do fine in the dishwasher when it gets dirty. Great investment. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sgw

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Sturdy Toy for a Cockatoo
customer_reviews.text: It's held up pretty good so far with my cockatoo that likes to tear all toys apart. He did manage to get the biggest spoon off of it(took him about 2 weeks), but the toy is still intact and he continues to bite on the rest of it. I bought it for the attractive colors that he would like and the rattling sound of the toys that he would like...gives him the opportunity to practice his biting skills.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie B.

customer_reviews.title: Terminator
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for one of our cockatoo's . He can destroy this in no time at all. It is fun to time him. He is like a little chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: This toy is to big for my small bird, Caique. Caique are about the size of a Conure.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Our Sun Conure loves this toy...I like the fact it's durable...he can't destroy it instantaneously...the spoons are what we really looking for for him...the added acrylic rings are a plus
customer_reviews.author: Arcticwolf

customer_reviews.title: My Goffin Cockatoo Loves these spoons!
customer_reviews.text: So far our Goffin loves these spoons. They have colorful bead and he spends lots of time trying to remove them from the chain. He was a little leary at first, but now this is his favorite toy. I highly recommend this toy!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hester

customer_reviews.title: Smaller n can not be hung as shown
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured can only hang vertically only has one hook. Impossable to hang as shown Also smaller then shown good for small parots
customer_reviews.author: altinstar

customer_reviews.title: My Scarlet Macaw LOVE it!!  Too much tho
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my Scarlet Macaw.. He LOVED IT!! But of course.. since he loved it he destroyed it rather quickly. It lasted a good week tho. I kept some of the pieces that weren't destroyed and will resting them on a stronger chain and industrial strength clips.. hahahaha maybe it will last longer. Great buy tho.
customer_reviews.author: Audra H.

customer_reviews.title: Bird toy
customer_reviews.text: This set of spoons goes in my African Gray's cage and she loves it. Very happy with the order and I will buy from this dealer again.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Our Parrot Love This
customer_reviews.text: We have a Nanday Conure and he loves this toy. When it is time for his snack, he gets super excited and starts shaking the spoons, plus if there is any object in which he can see his reflection, he will spend numerous amounts of time staring at himself. Yes, we have a vain parrot!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Rochd

customer_reviews.title: My cockatoo is crazy about this!
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly as pictured. I have a destructive cockatoo. He started playing with it immediately and it has become one of his favorite noise making toys.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: If your bird is is bigger then a cockatiel it is a waste
customer_reviews.text: Patriot rated I think not !!! My cockatoo shredded this toy in 2 hrs . In the trash it went .
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for him
customer_reviews.text: My Elenora cockatoo is an avid chewer so I am always on the lookout for toys that will last more than a day. He loves Bonka Toys and this was no exception. I purchased the spoons toy and the measuring cup toy and he loves them both. Warning! They make plenty of noise! Great for him . . . not so great for close neighbors, hahaha!
customer_reviews.author: S. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Macaw
customer_reviews.text: Picky, obnoxious bird finally satisfied with a toy. He hasn’t destroyed it (several months of use) and rattles it for attention instead of always screaming.
customer_reviews.author: 911pandora

customer_reviews.title: Was for my old african grey
customer_reviews.text: However, the materials are questionable with regard to the metal. I have preferred to used it as a viewing object for young cockatiels instead as I have no idea whether the metal is toxic.
customer_reviews.author: David Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This a super toy for your bird!!! It is strong and durable and will provide hours of activity and fun for your small to medium size birds.
customer_reviews.author: Tarabird48

customer_reviews.title: It gets a good beating, biting
customer_reviews.text: It's durable. My YN Amazon never gets tired of it. It's entertaining to watch her play with it because she tosses the spoon up when she can't break it off or takes it apart. She gets so angry yet she won't let go and keeps coming back for it. Similar to other toys, my husband gave it a couple of minutes before it breaks, but so far, after a month or so, they are still in one piece. It gets a good beating, biting, and tossing but it stays intact.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Instant Favorite with our Parrot!
customer_reviews.text: Our African Grey took an instant liking to this toy, and began playing with it immediately. He doesn't seem able to destroy the rings, and of course spoons are very familiar items. All in all it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JASON D EBERLY

customer_reviews.title: This is one he hasn't destroyed yet!
customer_reviews.text: My african grey is great at making short work of destroying his wood toys. He loves to play with this one and hasn't been able to wreck it yet. We're both very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves these spoons.
customer_reviews.text: My Double Yellow-Headed Amazon is always grabbing my spoon (if I let him) when I'm eating, so I bought him his own 'Spoon Delight' bird toy and he loves it. That's high praise because this bird prefers people stuff to bird toys. So thanks, Bonka Bird Toys, this is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Van

customer_reviews.title: Driver failed to put in front of door
customer_reviews.text: Driver put it on the side be front of door
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: African Grey Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My Grey loves playing with the spoons. He will shake them and throw them so they swing around wildly. He will even climb on top of the cage and grab it from above and shake it up and down. Finally a toy he can't destroy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Huber

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound
customer_reviews.text: My CAG likes bell and louder toys. She likes the spoons as they are made from metal and she can make some noise when she wants my attention. She is happy with them so I am too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Bleakney

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, you're bird will love it.
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo loved it so much! It lasted MUCH longer than other toys though, after a while she ended up breaking half the things off, but it took a good month at least! Most toys she destroys in a weekend. I'm purchasing another!
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: MY GREY LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have an African Grey who is 32 years old... He's very picky about his toys....This he loves! Lets see how long it takes to destroy - lol...
customer_reviews.author: JAMI

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyabke for my macaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my blue and gold macaw. He loves the clanking noises he can get out of it. Very durable for his big beak.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: She has so much fun with it and it's fun to watch her with ...
customer_reviews.text: My macaw loves this toy because it makes a big noise and it tickles her to no end!! She has so much fun with it and it's fun to watch her with it. The shipping was super quick and I had no problem with the seller. Thanks so much. A++++++ for this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for macaw!
customer_reviews.text: My macaw loves this toy... I have one in all 3 cages I have for her!
customer_reviews.author: William M. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: If you have an Aftrican Grey... you'll ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have an Aftrican Grey ... you'll know what i mean when I say He Loves it... didn't take but a day before it was hanging on his cage. I normally introduce toys a lot slower but he really wanted it...
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: My grey loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey loves banging these spoons against the cage and making noise with it. She was scared at first but then quickly adjusted and this became one of her favorite toys! She's a feather plucker but this toy helps keep her distracted from pulling those beautiful feathers
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for your Feathered Friends - Shiny, Bright and FUN to play with!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my Green Check and She LOVES them!! They are very Sturdy, Shiny and FUN to play with
customer_reviews.author: Sun Girl

customer_reviews.title: A winner
customer_reviews.text: Running Fox loves this toy. He was so excited at Christmas when he got the you. You can not argue with a bird, therefore he gives it s thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Ism using it for my lorikeet so far so good no rust 👍🏼

customer_reviews.title: Spoon Delight Toy
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey has to have this in his cage ALL THE TIME. He loves making clanging noise and this is the toy for him!
customer_reviews.author: bill wright

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We have an African Grey parrot “Cookie” and he loves his new toys. He also loves to destroy them. The spoon delight is sturdy that he can play with and not destroy in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie44

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and Durable
customer_reviews.text: My Macaw is having a great time playing with these he loves the noise and colors.. he hasn't been able to destroy them but he really just likes the noises and textures
customer_reviews.author: Just the Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Parrot loves it
customer_reviews.text: Parrot really liked it. Sometimes he hesitant with a new toy but he started playing with this one time I hung it. I was concerned it might not be tough enough but it’s holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Randy T

customer_reviews.title: Grey
customer_reviews.text: The African Grey likes it, spends hours playing with the spoons and looking at the reflection of it in the spoons
customer_reviews.author: BYREMS AVIARY

customer_reviews.title: The chain and welded rings are a good quality. It would be easy to attach a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very entertaining toy for my birds. Macaw has the plastic rings almost gone. The chain and welded rings are a good quality. It would be easy to attach a substitute in place of the plastic rings.
customer_reviews.author: slz

customer_reviews.title: Works , my grey hated them but my conure loves it t
customer_reviews.text: My African grey hated it , but my sun conure loves them.
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: Want to have fun???
customer_reviews.text: My Bailey (African Grey) loves the noise and reflection of the spoons. This is great as it cannot be destroyed in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Debrah127

customer_reviews.title: Bird toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is great my large macaw loves that it makes noise especially at 4 in the morning lol
customer_reviews.author: terri

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars I would My 20 year old African grey girl absolutely loves this toy. What more could ya want, bright acrylic beads and spoons that make noise
customer_reviews.author: sandra l. klint

customer_reviews.title: My Macaw hates it!
customer_reviews.text: I think its great, but sadly my Macaw hates it. He grabbed it while I had it and mouthed the beads and has not played with it sense it went in his cage.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Cockatoo
customer_reviews.text: Still exactly the same in my Cockatoo’s cage. He really likes the rings on there and he hasn’t bend or broken anything on this toy.
customer_reviews.author: roamieboy

customer_reviews.title: This did NOT look remotely like the pic shown
customer_reviews.text: This did NOT look remotely like the pic shown . It is NOT worth $14.99 . I am extremely disappointed in this product . What was sent was so cheap I could of made from the Dollar Store. It states not returnable . I'm assuming because it is a scam.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Moss

customer_reviews.title: Good Concept
customer_reviews.text: Bright toy with good concept, but my parrots were intimidated by the noises it makes; yours might not be. Will be moving it around and changing the hanging method to see if it generates more interest. (I think I like it more than they do!)
customer_reviews.author: Littlebip

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend and is durable because he has still not torn ...
customer_reviews.text: My bird hates every toy I buy him but started playing with this one right away and loves it. Highly recommend and is durable because he has still not torn it up.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Linnane

customer_reviews.title: My African gray just lost her spoons she loves the noise of them
customer_reviews.text: My African gray just lost her spoons she loves the noise of them
customer_reviews.author: michael r adams

customer_reviews.title: A Happy Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Our Amazon began playing immediately with the spoon toy. And it is great to have a toy he cannot destroy in five minutes :)
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Cockatoo seal of approval
customer_reviews.text: Storm the cockatoo likes to make noise. This is right up his alley. He didn’t know what to think at first, then he played after he heard it.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: This wonderful toy gives him hours for fun and is virtually ...
customer_reviews.text: Our African Gray loves bells, color, and tearing things apart. This wonderful toy gives him hours for fun and is virtually indestructible. With prompt delivery and great customer service, I couldn't ask for any more.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Ponticello

customer_reviews.title: A toy he can't destroy in 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: The longest toy he has ever had! Very durable and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: My new parakeet loves bells and any toys that make noise. This is perfect! He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Metal Spoons Good for African Greys & More
customer_reviews.text: This toy is for my shy Congo African Grey... We're still at the early introduction stage and she's more comfortable with this than any other thing I've introduced her to - so I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Schwatzwalder

customer_reviews.title: it’s rather pleasant like a wind chime
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey loves playing with this since she is attracted to the shiny spoons and loves making noise. The noise is not aggravating, it’s rather pleasant like a wind chime.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Queen

customer_reviews.title: Best Parrot Products From Bonka!!♥️♥️
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my parrot! Always love quality of Bonka parrot toys . I have bought from them many times at "Parrot" shows. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: Alex, our African Grey parrot, loves this toy. The spoons are shiny and that catches his interest.
customer_reviews.author: Don Elly

customer_reviews.title: It’s a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Product what is delivered and timely manner and in good shape.Hey durable product because my Amazon plays with it all the time and it’s held up very well
customer_reviews.author: BULL

product_meta.title: Bonka Bird Toys 1969 Spoon Delight African Grey Parrot Macaw
feature_bullets: The 1969 Spoon Delight from Bonka Bird Toys is a shiny and durable medium bird toy that pets love!
This reflective bird toy has lots of durable materials that are super pleasing to beaks and feet.
The 1969 Spoon Delight is a perfect toy for Macaws, Parrots, Cockatoos, Cockatiels and many more!
The spoons on this medium sized bird toy are made of sturdy stainless steel that last a long time.
The 1969 Spoon Delight is made with 100% bird safe materials and is sure to excite your pet bird!
